b'In 1961, looking for the ideal bottle gift wrap, Brown-Forman worked with Raymond Lowey to develop the first square gift bag.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'For a time during the \xe2\x80\x9890s, Brown-Forman operated a full-service travel agency: B-F Travel.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Last week, in honor of Veterans Day, @OldForester released "Honoring Our Military \'20" for pick up at Whiskey Row in Louisville.\n\nBottled at 100 proof, this Single Barrel Bourbon has notes of sweet dark cherry, vanilla custard, and baked apple. Sales of this speical offering supports the Old Forester donation to @semperfifund. #WhiskeyWednesday'
b'During WWII, Brown-Forman honored the holiday bonus for employees serving overseas.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In November of 1933, one month prior to the official Repeal of Prohibition in the US, the first whiskey was produced at our current campus.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b"Earlier this week, Brown-Forman's Luke Whitehead and his father and Veteran, Mr. Eddie Whitehead, conducted a virtual seminar on diversity in the military, as well as reflecting on Mr. Whitehead\xe2\x80\x99s Air Force experience. #VeteransDay"

b'As the weather gets cooler in Kentucky, the whiskey that had seeped into the porous wood shrinks and flows back into the liquid - aiding in the maturation process.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Over 60% of @Jackdaniels_Us Tennessee Whiskey volumes are international. Impressive, considering every drop is made in Lynchburg, TN - a town with a population of around 6,300 people.'
b'What does sustainability look like at Brown-Forman? Hear from Suzette Carty, Senior Manager Environmental Sustainability, in this recent interview with Environment + Energy Leader. Link in bio.'
b'Triple-casked, @SlaneWhiskey uses virgin and seasoned barrels from the Brown-Forman Cooperage and sherry casks from Spain. Once blended, the result is a phenomenal Irish Whiskey. #WhiskeyWednesday'

b'Staff Sgt. Donald Schaefer flew 29 missions during WWII and kept a bottle of @oldforester with him as a good luck charm, recording each one on the bottle. Schaefer was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross, the Air Medal with 3 Oak Clusters, and a Presidential Citation. #VeteransDay\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Created by @themocktailproject, this Cinnamon Pear Mule is an alcohol-free cocktail recipe for those who choose not to drink.

"Cinnamon Pear Mule" (Serving Size: 6-8 Mocktails)

Ingredients:
Pears, Thyme, Cinnamon, Brown-Sugar, Ginger Beer. 

Instructions:
Add Equal Parts Water & Brown-Sugar (2 Cups Each) into a saucepan

Add 1 full can of sliced pears into a saucepan

Add 8 Cinnamon Sticks into a saucepan (Personal Preference on Cinnamon) 

Add 4 Thyme Sprigs into a saucepan

Turn burner onto a low heat for 45-60 minutes and let simmer. Keep stirring ingredients to create a spiced thyme pear simple syrup.

After Brown-Sugar has dissolved let your simple syrup cool down to room temperature.

Add 2oz of your simple syrup into your glass over ice.

Add 4oz of your ginger beer of choice into your glass & stir well.

Garnish with pear from your saucepan and a fresh thyme sprig.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re proud of the work we do in our communities around the globe. In our hometown of Louisville, we\xe2\x80\x99ve made contributions to @metrounitedway since 1928 (when it was known as Community Chest).\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Did you know: @herradurateq uses a 100% natural fermentation process that takes up to 96 hours, using 16 different species of fruit trees and their own strains of house yeast. #Herradura150'

b'We recently started #MartiniMondays - an opportunity for our employees to engage with the @FordsGin team and Simon Ford to discuss all things gin.'

b'Our PRIDE ERG recently hosted a virtual lunch-and-learn to discover how Brown-Forman colleagues became allies to the LGBTQ+ community.\n\nA few tips shared included listening, education, getting involved, speaking up, intervening, welcoming discomfort, learning from your own mistakes, and staying engaged. #ManySpiritsOneBF'
b"Fun fact: @fordsgin first began as a concept on a bar's cocktail napkin."
b"Did you know: @glenglassaugh's dunnage warehousing dates back to 1875. #WhiskyWednesday"

b'In the 1940s and 1950s, Brown-Forman formed \xe2\x80\x9cB-F Industries,\xe2\x80\x9d a technology company that focused on improving photo chemicals and x-ray technologies.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'For\xc2\xa0#Mocktober, our partner in alcohol responsibility Jesse Hawkins from\xc2\xa0@theMocktailProject\xc2\xa0created this mocktail to be enjoyed during the fall season.

"Kentucky Pumpkin Ale"

\xe2\x80\xa2 Add 1.5oz REAL:trade_mark: Mixer's pumpkin puree into a shaker over light ice

\xe2\x80\xa2 Add 1oz of REAL:trade_mark: mixers into a shaker

\xe2\x80\xa2 1/2 oz fresh-squeezed lemon juice

\xe2\x80\xa2 Shake well and pour over ice into your serving glass and add 4 oz of original\xc2\xa0@ale8one:trade_mark: and then stir

\xe2\x80\xa2 Garnish with a lemon wedge'

b'Working alongside other industry leaders, Brown-Forman helped lead the charge to repeal Prohibition. After adding a few more members, the group eventually reformed as the new Kentucky Distillers\xe2\x80\x99 Association.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Created in 2012 by Brown-Forman and the Brown family, the DendriFund is an independent organization that focuses on inspiring joint #sustainability actions to solve challenges related to wood, water, and grains. Learn more at the link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cPause. A great mantra. It allows me to be thoughtful on how much I want to consume, but more importantly, how I want to feel the next day. I love how society is shifting from excessive consumption to moderation and more importantly, how Brown-Forman is proactive and supportive, so everyone can live their best life.\xe2\x80\x9d - Dani Hepperlin, Director, eCommerce \xe2\x80\x93 USA & Canada Brown-Forman'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThough it has no flesh and bones, nor emotions of its own, Brown-Forman has a well-known \xe2\x80\x98face\xe2\x80\x99 in Louisville. It is a \xe2\x80\x98face\xe2\x80\x99 that does not turn away from service to the community.\xe2\x80\x9d - George Garvin Brown II, 1965.

b'\xe2\x80\x9cMy message to people who want to be allies: you have to step outside of the culture you\xe2\x80\x99re living in\xe2\x80\xa6you have to enter into the experiences of those you want to be allies with.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRalph de Chabert, Senior VP and Chief Diversity Officer at Brown-Forman, sat down with @whas11 for \xe2\x80\x9cWhile I Have Your Attention.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b'In 1933, Brown-Forman became a publicly traded company with shares opening at $15.75 each. Adjusting for 14 share splits and 19 share dividends over the years, our share price would now be worth approximately $210,000.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Today many individuals will celebrate coming out as either LGBTQ or as an ally for them. Brown-Forman, our portfolio of brands, and all of our employees will celebrate with them. #NationalComingOutDay'

b'Led by our USA & Canada sales team, 150 bicycles and helmets were purchased and donated to the California neighborhood in our hometown of Louisville.\n\nLast week, employees volunteered their time to help assemble the bikes.'

b'Because we make our spirits with water, wood, and grain, the environment is important to us. When Brown-Forman embraced the agricultural industry in the 1940s and \xe2\x80\x9850s, we released \xe2\x80\x9cB-F SuperSol,\xe2\x80\x9d a beef feed supplement made from the distillery\xe2\x80\x99s old grains.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'On September 2, 1846, our founder, George Garvin Brown, was born in Munfordville, Kentucky. Five generations later, we are still a family company.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'#BourbonHeritageMonth recognizes the rich history of America\xe2\x80\x99s drink and its impact. And if you didn\xe2\x80\x99t know, our founder was the first to batch and bottle bourbon.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'"Working in the beverage alcohol industry is fun and exciting, but it\xe2\x80\x99s important that we set the example. Pause to consider if you really need that next drink at a party with friends. Pause to eat or have a glass of water. Pause to ensure you have a safe ride home." - Risa Sepkowski, Portfolio Field Marketing Manager at Brown-Forman'

b'Brown-Forman had a float in the Kentucky Derby Festival Parade for years. For our 100th anniversary in 1970, we went with a barrel design.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Brands like @OldForester wanted to help us perfect our Derby parties - even in 1969.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Join @jackdaniels_us in leaving a tip that means the world to the men and women behind the bar while also grabbing a custom t-shirt that shows your hometown support. Net proceeds benefit USBG National Charity Foundation. Link in bio.'

b'In 2017, @SonomaCutrer completed an on-site solar facility that produces an average of 150,000 kWh of energy each year. Sonoma-Cutrer also uses 100% of treated process wastewater for on-site vineyard irrigation. #Sustainability'

b"This year's $1,000 Mint Julep Cup program by @woodfordreserve honors the 50th anniversary of the first female jockey to ride in the Kentucky Derby - Diane Crump. The cup features etchings of Crump's jockey silks worn in 1970. Net proceeds will be donated in Crump\xe2\x80\x99s honor to the Permanently Disabled Jockeys Fund. #WhiskeyWednesday"

b"In 2009, Brown-Forman formed GROW (Growing Remarkable & Outstanding Women), an Employee Resource Group to promote women's equality within the company and community.

One of the first GROW co-leads, Leigh PIttman is now Director, Global Process Owner. #WomensEqualityDay

We\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 Stories in our IG Highlights."

b'"Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s a flavorful whiskey on the rocks, a favorite cocktail crafted with one of our many fine spirits, or an expressive glass of wine, our products are present during some of life\xe2\x80\x99s important moments. They are part of bringing people together in times of celebration, as well as quiet moments of reflection."\n\nOur 2020 Annual Report is now available. Link in bio.'

b'In 2018, @chambordliqueur announced its partnership with Alteristic, a national organization dedicated to reducing power-based personal violence, to provide a series of bystander intervention training workshops for the bartending community and our own employees.'

b'1870 was a good year! The whiskey sour cocktail was popularized and Brown-Forman was founded. Here\xe2\x80\x99s an old recipe we found in our own archives. #WhiskeySourDay\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'When we celebrated our 100th anniversary in 1970, we rented out the Brown Theatre and premiered \xe2\x80\x9cA Man Named Brown,\xe2\x80\x9d a Broadway-style musical celebrating our founder, George Garvin Brown.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of of #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIf we really want change to take place, we must stay motivated and engaged.\xe2\x80\x9c -Emmitt Smith\n\nIn partnership with our BUILD Employee Resource Group and the Office of Diversity & Inclusion, @herradurateq was thrilled to welcome the NFL\xe2\x80\x99s All-Time Leading Rusher, business leader, and tequila connoisseur, @emmittsmith22 to a virtual conversation with Brown-Forman employees to inspire them to not stay on the sidelines when it comes to anti-racism and social justice. Emmitt shared his personal stories and advice on how we can work together to build allyship and be champions for change.'

b'Founders Hall in Louisville used to be home to the B-F Tour Center and Museum. We found a note mentioning a breaking number of visitors (1,282) came in August 1965.
 
We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to open our homeplaces for tours again soon.

We\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Time flies. In August 2017, @OldForester installed its copper column still (named "Big Penny") on Whiskey Row. #WhiskeyWednesday'

b'Our Administration building in Louisville was inspired by the same architecture as seen on the University of Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s campus. The designing architect was the late Jay Stewart, a cousin of the Brown Family and UVA graduate. #BackToSchool\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Brown-Forman has had a presence in India since the early 1990s, when the then Advancing Marketing Group was formed. #IndianIndependenceDay\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Happy #NationalProseccoDay! @korbel_1882 is excited to join in the fun after launching their own Prosecco in late 2019.'
b'Congratulations to @woodfordreserve for surpassing the 1,000,000th case milestone during fiscal year 2020. #WhiskeyWednesday'

b'\xe2\x80\xaaBefore modern technology, it was nearly impossible to produce good whiskey in August in Kentucky because the spring water (used to cool vapors in the still) got too warm. In the 1940s, Brown-Forman experimented with storing ice and then using it to continue summer whiskey production.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'"After 150 years, when it comes to Brown-Forman, we know exactly who we are, where we\xe2\x80\x99re from, and what we do. We\xe2\x80\x99re distillers. We\xe2\x80\x99re from Kentucky. And we\xe2\x80\x99re here to stay." -George Garvin Brown IV'

b'\xe2\x80\xaaIn their spare time, Brown-Forman employees have liked to participate in company bowling leagues since August 1943.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Brown-Forman\xe2\x80\x99s Louisville campus went through a lot of changes in 1948 still seen today - including the closing of Howard Street between 18th and 19th streets.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all of our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Danny Whelan, YP UK Co-Lead, shares his journey as a Young Professional at Brown-Forman UK.'

b'In 2019, we unveiled \xe2\x80\x9cMany Spirits, One Brown-Forman,\xe2\x80\x9d our 2030 Strategy aimed at creating a foundation from which to build a more diverse workforce and inclusive culture. Brown-Forman\xe2\x80\x99s vision is to create an environment where leveraging diversity and inclusion occurs naturally. We have set gender and race ambitions to have at least 40 percent female senior leaders globally and 25 percent people of color in the United States by 2030.'

b'By the end of 2019, we achieved zero waste at 14 facilities. We continue to make progress toward our goal of sending zero-waste to landfill for all of our owned facilities by the end of calendar year 2020. #Sustainability'
b'"Our confidence is grounded in our proven ability to create, grow, steward and nurture iconic brands"\n\xe2\x80\x93Garvin Brown IV, Chairman, Board of Directors #NothingBetterInTheMarket'

b'On this date in 2009, a major thunderstorm caused a flash flood in Louisville. An estimated three to six inches of rain fell across the city in less than one hour, breaking all previous one-hour rainfall records in the area.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b"Jack Daniel's and Cola Ready-To-Drinks remain one of the best selling RTDs in the market.\n\nLink in bio."
b"PAUSE, our campaign for Alcohol Responsibility that started within Brown-Forman, turned one year old. Here's a recap of our events since we launched."

b'A year of celebrations and some challenges. We found new ways to work together, to help our communities, and live out our timeless values. This video premiered yesterday during our Annual Meeting of Stockholders. #BF150'
b'@SonomaCutrer has helped rose\xcc\x81 lovers celebrate summer responsibly since 2016.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In today\xe2\x80\x99s Annual Meeting of Stockholders, we announced plans for a $20 million donation to the Brown-Forman Foundation. Established in 2018, the Brown-Forman Foundation focuses on arts and culture, education, social services, environmental sustainability, and reduction of alcohol-related harm. Today\xe2\x80\x99s announcement is a reflection of our ongoing commitment to our community, especially the community where our west Louisville headquarters resides, and our desire to extend our culture of caring outside the walls of Brown-Forman.

Change begins at home. We must continue to do our part to make our neighborhood, our communities, and the world in which we live better.

Link in bio.'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve held our Annual Meeting of Stockholders in July since 1934.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'For our 125th anniversary in 1995, @OldForester produced commemorative 125-proof whiskey for employees.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'This year Brown-Forman celebrates 150 years of company and community growth. Join us by using #BF150 as we take a look at our past and take steps towards our future.'

b'Formerly known as the Old Oscar Pepper Distillery, Brown-Forman first purchased the site and distillery that is known today as @woodfordreserve in July 1941.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Brown-Forman employee social groups have existed since the 1930s and have included organizations like Cork & Barrel, sports leagues, and many others.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'As a Louisville-based company, we are taking a leadership role in addressing the racial divide and inequalities in our local communities. We are committed to being better neighbors in the home of our Louisville corporate campus - the California neighborhood.

Here\xe2\x80\x99s an overview:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in a diversity council sponsored by @glichamber.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Support minority students interested in STEM.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Pledge $150,000 in scholarship money to help local students further education.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Pledge $500,000 to @louisville_ul to help advance their mission to assist African Americans and other marginalized populations in attaining social and economic equality through direct services and advocacy.'
b'@herradurateq introduced the Reposado tequila expression to the world in 1974. #NationalTequilaDay.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'The roof of the Forester Center in Louisville is covered in living vegetation to reduce stormwater runoff and increase energy efficiency.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In July 1945, the Bluegrass Cooperage in Louisville was founded. Today it is known as the Brown-Forman Cooperage.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'As bars and restaurants continue to offer to-go cocktails, our sales teams in the United States have offered these PAUSE stickers to accounts as a reminder to consumers to not drink and drive and consume responsibly once they get home.'

b'Remember when people traveled? Brown-Forman owned Hartmann Luggage, one of the oldest luggage manufacturers in the US, from 1983 to 2007. During that time, Hartman\xe2\x80\x99s headquarters was nestled in Tennessee near @jackdaniels_us.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In the coming months, we commit to providing additional resources for the Invest California initiative. Invest California will focus on improving education, economic development, and wealth-building for our closest neighbors, the majority of whom are African American.\n\nLink in bio.'

b'In 2002, filmmakers working on \xe2\x80\x9cSeabiscuit\xe2\x80\x9d needed whiskey barrels from the 1930s and antique bottles to use as props. Brown-Forman was able to answer the call with Master Distiller Chris Morris lending a few from his personal collection.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'@SonomaCutrer uses 100% of treated process wastewater for on-site vineyard irrigation. The water used for our processes at the winery is also treated in wastewater treatment ponds and then reused for vineyard irrigation. #Sustainability'

b'ICYMI: @OldForester announced "Old Fo To Go," a new curbside pickup initiative featuring curated distillery offerings. A percentage of the proceeds will be donated to @FundfortheArts Cultural Lou Recovery. #WhiskeyWednesday'

b'Located in Versailles, KY, @WoodfordReserve Distillery is home to some of the oldest distilling traditions in Kentucky. Adding to its history, Woodford Reserve recently added "Five Wood" to its whiskey portfolio - a new, limited-edition whiskey that has been aged in five different styles of barrels, creating a unique profile that bursts with rich fruit flavors.'

b'In 2020, Brown-Forman became the first company in Louisville to receive a 100% on the @humanrightscampaign \xe2\x80\x9cBest Places to Work for LGBT Equality\xe2\x80\x9d designation 10 years in a row. #Pride\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In 1992, as part of expanded marketing efforts around the globe, Brown-Forman Japan opened its doors. We currently have 60 offices in over 30 countries.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Introduced in 1957, our corporate symbol was created by famed industrial designer Raymond Loewy.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'In June of 1924, Brown-Forman purchased the property on Dixie Highway in Louisville where our corporate Campus is to this day.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Those that had been at Brown-Forman for ten or more years in 1944 were invited to a special luncheon to celebrate their anniversary and admit them into the newly organized Ten-Year Club. Today, the average tenure for B-F employees in the US is nearly 10 years.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG highlights.'

b'To help the war effort, Brown-Forman converted distillery equipment to produce high proof alcohol to be used as torpedo fuel.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG highlights.'

b'This wall, located in the lobby of our Admin building, represents the global presence that Brown-Forman has as one of the largest American-owned spirits and wine companies with brands in more than 170 countries.\n\nThe wall itself is covered with pieces of used barrel staves while the map is made up of the outlines of the bottles of our products.'

b'In 2009, @herradurateq was the first organization to feature a wastewater treatment facility that met all the regulatory requirements in Mexico.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Brown-Forman committed itself to renewable energy in 2018 by purchasing 30 megawatts of electricity annually from Solomon Forks Wind Project (Kansas) for the next 15 years.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'There have been many great father/child teams throughout Brown-Forman\xe2\x80\x99s history - such as Todd and Kasey Allgeier, USA and Canada region. #FathersDay\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'A tagline used by @finlandia_vodka since 1970, \xe2\x80\x9cBorn under the midnight sun\xe2\x80\x9d recognizes the long summer days that occur between May and August in Finland and the Summer Solstice in-between. #FirstDayofSummer\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe can all walk the same halls, but we don\xe2\x80\x99t all have the same realities.\xe2\x80\x9d -Ralph de Chabert, Chief Diversity, Inclusion, and Community Relations Officer

Last month, a Fieldcast podcast was published where Ralph spoke on the benefits of diversity and inclusion at a company and why it\xe2\x80\x99s important for everyone to see themselves reflected in their organization.

Link in bio.'
b'While living in London at the time, Nikola Dimov, Human Resources, became co-lead for PRIDE in 2017.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'PRIDE month is typically filled with marches, parades, and pleas for freedom and fairness. As we move throughout PRIDE month under these unprecedented times, our PRIDE employee resource group (ERG) is looking at their \xe2\x80\x9cLive Freely\xe2\x80\x9d slogan with heavy hearts. They shared a message that is echoed by Brown-Forman: We want our Black colleagues to know that we are here. We are listening. And we will stand with you.\n\nThis image combines the logos of our BUILD and PRIDE ERGs. This year is different in so many ways but one similarity rings true: freedom and fairness are what we will continue to fight for and will do so with more open eyes than ever.'

b'\xe2\x80\xaaIn 1870, George Garvin Brown created Old Forester on Louisville\xe2\x80\x99s famous Whiskey Row. In 2018, @oldforester returned to the same spot on #NationalBourbonDay.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all our #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'
b'Be Better, Do Better. Read what that means, including actionable commitment from our Executive Leadership Team on eliminating barriers to inclusion. Link in Bio.'

b'The events of the last few weeks have reinforced the undeniable need for individuals and organizations to examine bias, racism, and all forms of inequity that exist in our communities. Last year, we developed and shared internally Many Spirits, One Brown-Forman: Gender and Race Edition, our ten-year strategy that sets forth our diversity and inclusion opportunities, challenges, vision, and ambitions. Among these ambitions, we aspire to increase representation of all key racial and ethnic demographic groups in all of our management levels in the U.S. by 2030.\n\nThe document is required reading for all Brown-Forman employees and now we are pleased to offer you the opportunity to read the strategy in its entirety. We believe you too will see the potential that can exist when many spirits come together for one Brown-Forman. Link in Bio. #ManySpiritsOneBF'

b'Brown-Forman and our employees will continue to listen, learn, and build awareness on race and diversity. We invite you to watch on YouTube as our industry came together as a community to reflect on its history and recent events.

Earlier this week, Melvin Keebler, Assistant General Manager of @jackdaniels_us, our friend @fawn.weaver, CEO of @UncleNearest Premium Whiskey, and others gathered online for an engaging conversation with @FredMinnick, best-selling author and bourbon authority. Minnick organized the event in support of Chris Montana, owner of @DuNordCS, a Minneapolis-based distillery severely damaged during the protests.

Link in bio to watch the event.'

b'As our world continues to mourn and protest the loss of Ahmaud Arbery, George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, and too many others, our Executive Leadership Team at Brown-Forman shared this message with employees beginning last Friday. We are now sharing that message on Instagram so that you too, understand the work we will continue to do to uphold our value of respect, eliminate bias, and create a company that enables each of us to bring our best selves to work. Link in Bio.'

b'In June of 2014, @jackdaniels_us celebrated LGBTQ diversity on social media, becoming the first of many Brown-Forman brands to do so. #ManySpiritsOneBF #PrideMonth\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re sharing all #BF150 Stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'We are pleased to announce for the fifth year in a row, Brown-Forman France has been named a Great Place to Work. We look forward to celebrating this achievement together in person in Paris soon.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cAt Brown-Forman we live by strong values of integrity and excellence. Our whiskies have such rich, authentic backgrounds. Our production processes, for each of our brands, are unique. Our distilleries are beautiful. The quality of our ingredients is undeniable. Our whisk(e)y brands have stories to keep you amazed and entertained for months! I am grateful for representing and growing these phenomenal whiskies, alongside people that are supportive of one another\xe2\x80\x99s aspirations, and a company that stimulates us all to grow.\xe2\x80\x9d - Thalita Alves, Brand Ambassador, Australia.

Congratulations to Thalita for being recognized as the 2020 American Whiskey Brand Ambassador of the Year for the Global  #IconsOfWhisky hosted by @Whisky_Magazine!

b'Prior to moving to our remote work environments due to COVID-19, B-F India celebrated Holi last month with an event for employees to welcome the festival of spring. Traditional Holi snacks such Gujiya and Thandai were served, along with Holi-inspired games.'

b'In the 1990s, @jackdaniels_US introduced a line of beers to the market: the 1866 Classic Pilsner, Pale Ale, and Amber Lager. #NationalBeerDay\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'During these difficult and uncertain times, we continue to look for ways to support each other and our neighbors. For the month of April, Brown-Forman is donating meals to food pantry organizations in the California neighborhood, the home of our Louisville campus.

Our Bourbon Street Caf\xc3\xa9, Events & Hospitality, and Community Relations teams have partnered to assemble and distribute approximately 2,000 bagged lunches each day, for a monthly total of nearly 40,000 meals. Our team is assembling sandwich lunches with snacks, fruit, and dessert at our campus, and partnering with @wiltpantry1 to distribute to our community neighbors.

With the health and safety of our employees and communities as our top priority, extensive precautions are being taken during meal preparation and distribution.

Thank you to all the team members who have been a part of this effort - your work is making a real difference in the lives of our community neighbors.

#TeamKentucky #TogetherKY'

b'After a tornado devastated our Louisville community in April 1974, Brown-Forman employees helped each other and the community through multiple volunteer and labor efforts.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'#TBT: Our PRIDE ERG in Australia celebrated Fair Day with the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras (SGLMG) in February.

One of the oldest continuously operating LGBTQI organizations in Australia, SGLMG was built on the foundations laid by early community activists who fought for LGBTQI rights in a time of widespread, institutionalized oppression and discrimination.

PRIDE served up some Brown-Forman drink favorites to celebrate the start of Mardi Gras.

#ManySpiritsOneBF'

b'SPIRIT, a Brown-Forman employee resource group, was an industry first and supports Brown-Forman\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to creating an environment where all employees feel welcome as contributing members of the organization, regardless of their own choice of whether or not to drink. #ResponsibilityMonth\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Congratulations to Sara Eitel (Tourism Business Analytics Manager) for being recognized by GROW as one of the most recent Spirited Persons Award winners.\n\nThe GROW Spirited People Award, sponsored by @chambordliqueur, is an opportunity to recognize the women and men all around the world who have influenced or inspired other women on a personal or professional level to unlock their desired potential or who have been champions for change.'

b'Congratulations to LaToya McCellan (HR Manager, Finance & IT) for being recognized by GROW as one of the Spirited Persons Award winners.\n\nThe GROW Spirited People Award, sponsored by @chambordliqueur, is an opportunity to recognize the women and men all around the world who have influenced or inspired other women on a personal or professional level to unlock their desired potential or who have been champions for change.'

b'Integrity, one of our core values, is rooted in the personal integrity of George Garvin Brown who was recognized with the Integrity Cup for paying off a debt for which he had long been forgiven.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'Our Research & Development team continues to produce and package hand sanitizer to reduce the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus). Since last week, we have been able to donate drums of hand sanitizer to health care providers and first responders who are on the front lines of this pandemic, including Louisville EMS and Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

Distribution of the sanitizer will be handled by partnering with local government response teams, as they are best equipped to handle allocation to those who need it most. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation as we work together to keep our communities safe. If you have any questions, please email hand_sanitizer@b-f.com.

#TogetherKY'

b'@finlandia_vodka was created in 1970. In 1971, it came to the United States.

This year, we help them celebrate their 50th anniversary.

b'One of the most popular features at Brown-Forman is the Bourbon Street Caf\xc3\xa9, an in-house employee restaurant that often serves food cooked with Brown-Forman spirits. The current version of the Caf\xc3\xa9 was commissioned by Owsley Brown II and constructed in 1996.

We look forward to reopening the Cafe soon to employees and their guests again soon.

b'While the Research & Development (R&D) team at Brown-Forman plays an important role in building our brands, they are currently focused on a different type of product to reduce the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus). R&D developed, produced, and packaged hand sanitizer for our production teams to keep them safe and healthy while they are keeping our operations up and running.\n\nAll remaining sanitizer is being given to Louisville and Moore County (home to the Jack Daniel Distillery) health care providers and first responders who are on the front lines of this pandemic.'

b'Elizabeth McCall, Woodford Reserve\xe2\x80\x99s Assistant Master Distiller, helps ensure the integrity and quality of @WoodfordReserve\xe2\x80\x99s bourbon. She is the second in her family to enter into the spirits industry, following in her mother\xe2\x80\x99s footsteps.

b'Our bottling department is one of the oldest departments within the corporation that have been operating since our founding.\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re saving all #BF150 stories in our IG Highlights.'

b'The health, safety, and wellbeing of our employees continues to be our first and utmost priority. With the constant influx of news associated with COVID-19, and the rapidly changing dynamics of our daily life, it is very easy to see how this situation could become overwhelming and stressful.

WeCare, our internal platform designed to support and inform employees during times of crisis, is being utilized to share internal and external updates on Coronavirus as well as direct our employees to our Employee Assistance Program.

There, employees have access to a variety of resources, including counseling for stress and anxiety.

We look forward to connecting face to face soon at events like this one from Black History Month in February.'
b'We at Brown-Forman and @slanewhiskey wish you a happy and responsible #StPatricksDay\xc2\xa0at home.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cAt the end of the day, George Brown is an example of a great American entrepreneur \xe2\x80\x93 someone who took the then novel idea of bottling bourbon and creating a business built on his own commitment and integrity.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\xe2\xa0\x80\nOur founder, George Garvin Brown, was posthumously admitted into the Junior Achievement Business Hall of Fame. Sandra Frazier, fifth generation Brown family member and former Director, accepted the award on his behalf.'
b'Brown-Forman has always contributed to the Arts in Louisville and made it a point to incorporate art throughout its campus. #BF150'

b"In honor of #InternationalWomensDay, Brown-Forman employees are participating in #EachForEqual to advocate for a Gender-Equal world.

The global celebration acknowledges the social, economic, cultural, and political achievements of women and marks a call to action for accelerating women's equality.

Check out our IG Stories to see employees from around the world joining the challenge, including our GROW ERG executive sponsors, Alex Alvarez, Chief Production and Sustainability Officer and Maureen Brekka, SVP Managing Director Emerging Brands."

b'Brown-Forman, Woodford Reserve, DendriFund, Brown family farms, and several others provided match support to American Farmland Trust for the recent award from the KY Agriculture Development Board to expand commercial rye cover crop trials across the state.'
